#Text=Wikinews interviews President of the International
#Text=Brotherhood of Magicians
#Text=Wednesday , October 9 , 2013
#Text=File photo of magician David Gish displaying magic props for a young child .
#Text=Image : Paul Budd .
#Text=October is National Magic Month in the United States .
#Text=Wikinews spoke with William Evans , president of the International Brotherhood of Magicians , about the current state of magic and what its future looks like in the world of entertainment .
#Text=( ( Wikinews ) ) For how long have you been involved in performing/studying magic ?
#Text=William Evans : Over 50 years .
#Text=I am 61 now so I really started when I was about 10 years old even though I had seen and worked with some basic tricks a few years earlier .
#Text=I remember going into Hollywood Magic and wanting that big red box with the dragons on it and I did n't even know what it did .
#Text=The magician behind the counter was wise enough not to sell it to me , but instead sold me two books which I still own today — " Scarne on Card Tricks " and " Scarne on Magic Tricks " .

column1: #Text=That started me out on books and I have amassed quite a few since then .
#Text=My major influences on performance are Eugene Burger and Michael Skinner .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) October is National Magic Month in the US .
#Text=Do you think magic is alive as a viable form of entertainment today ?
#Text=WE : Absolutely .
#Text=There are more magicians working today than ever before .
#Text=There will always be an audience for good magicians doing good magic .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Has the internet helped or hurt magic ?
#Text=WE : Both .

#Text=I think it has helped draw younger people to magic as a hobby , but I think it has hurt the ability of young magicians to think because so many rely on the internet for everything and they are n't reading the books .
#Text=We have to have knowledge of the history of magic and what has been done before .
#Text=Moreover , seeing someone perform on the internet takes away the use of our senses , originality and imagination that reading and thinking about magic can produce .
#Text=Anyone can become a monkey ; it takes serious study to become a magician .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Do you travel much in your current role ?
#Text=WE : Yes , I am traveling quite a bit .

#Text=After I was inducted as International President in Phoenix in July , I have been to the Jeff McBride Experience in Eureka Springs , Arkansas , Magic Live in Las Vegas , The Midwest Magic Jubilee in St. Louis , the TAOM in Dallas , the British Ring Convention in Buxton , England and the Magic Circle in London .

#Text=I am going to Las Vegas and Los Angeles next month , Italy in November , back to Las Vegas in December , Mexico in January , Magi-Fest in February , the Winter Carnival of Magic in Tennessee in March , Eureka Springs Cavalcade of Magic in March , and the FFFF in April .
#Text=That 's as of now .
